column9: Am I eligible for the 1 month free trial on FairPrice Digital Club?
column10:
All FairPrice online customers who have not been a Digital Club member for the past 6 months are eligible for the 1st-month free trial. To check your eligibility, visit the sign-up page with your registered account.

Eligible customers will be able to see $0.00 on the payment page for their 1st month subscription.

column4: I need to cancel an online order
column5:

For bulk orders, cancellation after the order confirmation is subjected to a surcharge of $30 (incl. GST).
If you have applied promo code to the order, the promo code can be reused after the order is cancelled. Please apply it on a new order before the original expiry date.

Step 3: Click "Cancel order"
Step 4: "Select a reason" for cancellation and click "Submit"
Step 5: Your order will be cancelled

column4: Can I change my delivery address or delivery date after placing an order?
column5:
For home deliveries, you may change your delivery address or delivery date by informing us at least 24 hours before the scheduled delivery. Otherwise, there will be a charge of $7 for the amendment. For bulk orders, there is a fee of $30 to make the change and will be charged to the same credit card that was used to pay for the order; It will be a separate charge from the original order payment.

Do note that the delivery date can be postponed only up to 7 days later and is only allowed a one-time amendment. Should you require to make further amendment due to exigencies, please cancel the order and place a new one.  Amendment to an earlier date will be subject to slot availability. Please submit your request via the web form below
https://help.fairprice.com.sg/hc/en-us/requests/new

column4: How do I enable cookies to log into FairPrice?
column5:
What are cookies and why are they helpful?
Cookies are files created by websites you visit. They make your online experience easier by saving browsing information on your browser. With cookies, you can:

Keep you signed in - to improve your shopping experience
Remember your site preferences - to manage your personal shopping list
Give you locally relevant content - to bring you the best offers
How do I enable cookies on my Internet Browser?
On popular browsers, such as Chrome, Edge, or Safari, you can go into the browser's settings under Privacy/Security settings to unblock cookies. Do note that cookies are unblocked by default on any new devices, and you will only need to unblock cookies if they had been explicitly blocked.

Here are some guides on how to enable cookies for specific browsers:

Google Chrome
Samsung Internet
Apple Safari
iPhone Safari
Mozilla Firefox
Microsoft Edge
If you do not know which browser you are on (or not shown above), click below on your device to automatically go to the correct guide.
https://www.whatismybrowser.com/guides/how-to-enable-cookies/auto

Third-party cookies are not required to be enabled for FairPrice to keep you logged in.

column4: What are the key benefits of a single login screen?
column5:
There are many benefits as we move towards a single login screen:

You are able to access your favourite services through a single login screen at any time, on any device. You can easily remember one email address and password to stay logged in, within a single device, and access various services across FairPrice Group. We have also introduced signing up with a mobile number for users who do not frequent their email. 
You will be able to manage all of your personal information within a single account. Information that was updated on your account will be automatically propagated across connected services across various FairPrice Group. 
You will be able to access a single preferences page to manage all of your consent across different businesses and receive offerings from FairPrice Group. You will have full control of your consent to receive marketing materials or not.

column4: MyInfo verification on FairPrice
column5:
Why is FairPrice asking for MyInfo verification?
It is for an upcoming feature where we are able to accurately and automatically identify our customer for purchasing of controlled and age-restricted items.

MyInfo verification is optional and we can remove the verification and all the associated data that you have previously shared with us. Once removed, you might have to do so through the same process. 
So long you wish to purchase alcohol in-store, verifying your age through NRIC is still required by customers. 
In order for senior citizens to be entitled for Merdeka Generation/Pioneer Generation/Senior discounts, physical verfication is required by our staff at our physical stores.

column4: What is Vulnerability Disclosure?
column5:
Vulnerability disclosure is the practice of reporting security vulnerabilities (i.e. flaws or weaknesses) in computer software or hardware.

As part of our commitment to provide a secure environment for the general public and customers using our online services, we have established a Vulnerability Disclosure Programme (VDP), for the community to report security vulnerabilities. We will be glad to hear from you if you encounter security vulnerabilities when accessing our online services.

For more information on the Programme and how to report a vulnerability, please visit our VDP policy page here, 
https://www.ntucenterprise.sg/contactus/vulnerability-disclosure-programme/

column4: Orders Service Fee Structure
column5:
While the surge in visits to our online platform has stabilised, the ongoing pandemic continues to place heavy demands on our existing grocery infrastructure.

We have intensified our efforts in allowing more customers to order their groceries online. We invested heavily in upgrading our infrastructure and training about 150 new staff to become skilled pickers and packers. This resulted in an increase of 25% in the number of delivery slots available for online customers. We will continue to hire more staff and also further increase our online capacity, among various other activities.

We adopt a transparent pricing approach - there are no hidden mark-ups on products themselves as we maintain uniform prices with our brick-and-mortar stores. The service fee partially covers only part of the total costs of processing, picking and packing online grocery orders.

Beyond this, a multi-tiered delivery fee structure was also introduced to provide more flexibility for shoppers to vary their basket sizes and optimise savings for their online purchases. This has made shopping online for groceries accessible to more households and complements the current extensive footprint of our brick-and-mortar stores. The multi-tiered delivery fee structure for our online platform is as follows:

- Glass bottles

column4: How do I know if I am eligible for the Corporate Rebate Scheme?
column5:
A business user must have a valid business user account on our corporate website, https://www.fairprice.com.sg to be eligible.

Subject to the Terms and Conditions of the Scheme, business users who spent a minimum monthly cumulative amount on the Website is entitled to receive a rebate (“Rebate”) as follows:

Qualifying Monthly Spent:
1) $500-$1000 - Rebate $20 via promo code
2) $1000 and above - Rebate $50 via promo code
mceclip0.png

Qualifying monthly spent is based on the final invoiced amount (excluding delivery fee) for all orders delivered by NTUC FairPrice between the 1st day of the month and the last day of the month. 

Purchase of FairPrice Online E-Vouchers is excluded from calculation of the qualifying monthly spent.

The rebate is in the form of return promotional code.

Each business user account is entitled to only one Rebate each month.

The denominations are $20 and $50.

Qualified business users will receive an email with the Rebate Promo Code within 7 business days from the last calendar day of the preceding month. Business day means any day other than a weekend, an official public holiday, or a day upon which banks are otherwise generally closed for business in Singapore.

Rebate Promo Code is valid for 1 month from the date of issuance.

If the Rebate Promo Code is not redeemed within the stipulated period, it will be deemed forfeited. 

The Return Promotional Code is only applicable with an order placed on our corporate website. 

The Return Promotional Code is not stackable with other promotion codes or coupons.

column4: Multi-Tiered Delivery Fee Structure
column5:
Dear Business Users

In these extraordinary circumstances, we continue to ramp up our operation capacity with enhanced safety measures to support your business needs. During the past two months, we have also intensified our efforts and made heavy investments to: 

Upgrade infrastructure to increase delivery slots by 25%
Hire and train additional 150 pickers and packers.
To better support your business needs and to ensure greater accessibility to all business users, we will introduce a multi-tiered delivery fee structure that includes both service and delivery fee that will take effect from 3 June 2020 onwards. This fee will partially cover the cost of processing, picking, packing and delivering of online grocery orders. We adopt a transparent pricing approach - there are no hidden mark-ups on products themselves as our online platform maintains uniform prices with our brick-and-mortar stores. 

New Multi-Tiered Delivery Fee Structure

In order to provide more flexibility for our business users to vary their basket sizes and optimise savings for their online purchases, the new multi-tiered delivery fee structure (incl. Service Fee) will be as follows:
Order value (SGD)       

Delivery charge (SGD)

$300 and above

Delivery charge waived

Between $59 to $300      

$3.99

Below $59

$8.99

 FAQs:

Will business users need to pay for service fee on top of the new multi-tiered delivery fee? 

For business users, the service fee is included in the new multi-tiered delivery fee structure. Hence, there is no additional service  fee on top of the delivery fee.

 
What is the difference between delivery fee and service fee (picking and packing)?

For Business users, service fee is included in the new multi-tiered delivery fee structure. However, for better understanding of both definitions:

Service Fee: To partially cover the costs of processing, picking and packing online grocery orders.

Delivery Fee: For the cost of transportation from the place where it was prepared to your doorstep.

 If I hit the minimum free delivery amount, do I still need to pay for service fee?

No, the service fee is included in the new multi-tiered delivery fee structure for business users. 

 
If I cancel my order, will you refund the delivery fee?

Cancellations made more than 24 hours prior to the scheduled delivery date will be refunded to the same mode of payment, at full amount including all applicable charges. Penalty fees apply for cancellations made in less than 24 hours. Read more here: https://help.fairprice.com.sg/hc/en-us/articles/360021859391-I-need-to-cancel-an-online-order-


What happens to the delivery fee when some items are not delivered due to out of stock  after I placed the order?

Any amendment in delivery date, time or item quantity will not affect the delivery fee. 

 
Why is there a need to introduce this multi-tiered delivery structure?

We introduce a multi-tiered delivery fee structure, to provide more flexibility for business users  to vary their basket sizes and optimise savings for their online purchases, making online groceries accessible to more businesses.

NTUC FairPrice Co-operative Limited (“NTUC FairPrice”) is pleased to launch the Corporate Rebate Scheme (“Scheme”) for qualifying business users who purchased on our FairPrice for Business’ website at fairprice.com.sg (the “Website”).

Subject to the Terms and Conditions of the Scheme, business users who spent a minimum monthly cumulative amount on the Website is entitled to receive a rebate (“Rebate”) as follows:

Qualifying Monthly Spent:
1) $500-$1000 - Rebate $20 via promo code
2) $1000 and above - Rebate $50 via promo code

Terms & Condition

Qualifying period

The Scheme starts on 1st June 2020 and shall remain valid until further notice.
Qualifying criteria

To qualify for the Scheme, a business user must have a valid business user account for the Website (“Account”). 
Qualifying Monthly Spend

Qualifying monthly spent is based on the final invoiced amount (excluding delivery fee) for all orders delivered by NTUC FairPrice between the 1st day of the month and the last day of the month.
Purchase of FairPrice Online E-Vouchers is excluded from calculation of the qualifying monthly spent. 
Issuance of rebate and redemption

Each Account is entitled to only one Rebate each month.
Rebate will be given in the form of e-promotional code, in the denomination of $20 and $50 (“Rebate Promo Code”).
Qualified Account will receive an email with the Rebate Promo Code within 7 business days from the last calendar day of the preceding month. Business day means any day other than a weekend, an official public holiday, or a day upon which banks are otherwise generally closed for business in Singapore.
Rebate Promo Code is valid for 1 month from the date of issuance. If the Rebate Promo Code is not redeemed within the stipulated period, it will be deemed forfeited. 
Rebate Promo Code is only applicable with an order placed on the Website and is not stackable with other promotion codes or coupons.
Rebate Promo Code is non-transferable and non-exchangeable for cash, credit or kind.
In the event an order is cancelled and/or reversed (in whole or in part), the said order will be disqualified from the calculation of the qualifying monthly spent. NTUC FairPrice reserves the right to invalidate the Rebate Promo Code and/or claim the full cost of the Rebate from the Account / business user in the event that the eligible order(s) is cancelled or reversed after the Rebate has been awarded.
Other terms

By participating in the Scheme, business users agree to be bound by the rules, regulations and decisions of NTUC FairPrice and by these Terms and Conditions. Failure to comply with these Terms and Conditions will result in a disqualification of the business users from the Scheme.
NTUC FairPrice reserves the right to claim the full cost of the Rebate or invalidate the Rebate Promo Code issued to an Account who may subsequently be disqualified or deemed ineligible for the Scheme.
NTUC FairPrice will not be responsible for any loss, claim or liability whatsoever suffered or incurred by any person in connection with the Scheme (including the acceptance or possession of any Rebate) howsoever arising, including without limitation, any loss of opportunity to participate in the Scheme due to any orders not received by NTUC FairPrice for any reasons whatsoever, any error or breakdown or malfunction in any computing system or equipment, any notice which is misdirected or lost in transit, claims, cost, injuries, losses, or damages related to personal injuries, death, damage to, loss or destruction of property, rights of publicity or privacy, or defamation. 
The decision of NTUC FairPrice on all matters relating to the Scheme is final, conclusive and binding. 
NTUC FairPrice is entitled to replace the form of Rebate with another item, or cancel, terminate, modify or suspend the Scheme at any time in their sole discretion without notice.
In the event of any inconsistency between these Terms and Conditions and any brochures, marketing or promotional materials relating to this Scheme, these Terms and Conditions shall prevail.
These Terms and Conditions shall be governed by the Singapore laws. 
The Singapore courts shall have the exclusive jurisdiction for any disputes arising from these Terms and Conditions.

Step 5: Your order will be cancelled

column9: How do I enable cookies to log into FairPrice?
column10:
What are cookies and why are they helpful?
Cookies are files created by websites you visit. They make your online experience easier by saving browsing information on your browser. With cookies, you can:

Keep you signed in - to improve your shopping experience
Remember your site preferences - to manage your personal shopping list
Give you locally relevant content - to bring you the best offers
How do I enable cookies on my Internet Browser?
On popular browsers, such as Chrome, Edge, or Safari, you can go into the browser's settings under Privacy/Security settings to unblock cookies. Do note that cookies are unblocked by default on any new devices, and you will only need to unblock cookies if they had been explicitly blocked.

Here are some guides on how to enable cookies for specific browsers:

Google Chrome
Samsung Internet
Apple Safari
iPhone Safari
Mozilla Firefox
Microsoft Edge
If you do not know which browser you are on (or not shown above), click below on your device to automatically go to the correct guide.
https://www.whatismybrowser.com/guides/how-to-enable-cookies/auto

Third-party cookies are not required to be enabled for FairPrice to keep you logged in.

column9: Orders Service Fee Structure
column10:
While the surge in visits to our online platform has stabilised, the ongoing pandemic continues to place heavy demands on our existing grocery infrastructure.

We have intensified our efforts in allowing more customers to order their groceries online. We invested heavily in upgrading our infrastructure and training about 150 new staff to become skilled pickers and packers. This resulted in an increase of 25% in the number of delivery slots available for online customers. We will continue to hire more staff and also further increase our online capacity, among various other activities.

We adopt a transparent pricing approach - there are no hidden mark-ups on products themselves as we maintain uniform prices with our brick-and-mortar stores. The service fee partially covers only part of the total costs of processing, picking and packing online grocery orders.

Beyond this, a multi-tiered delivery fee structure was also introduced to provide more flexibility for shoppers to vary their basket sizes and optimise savings for their online purchases. This has made shopping online for groceries accessible to more households and complements the current extensive footprint of our brick-and-mortar stores. The multi-tiered delivery fee structure for our online platform is as follows:

Once the patch has been installed, no further action is needed.

1. Please ensure that you have upgraded to Firefox version 34 or above. This will disable SSL3 as default setting.

   a. After launching the Mozilla browser, enter the text “about:config” in the search or enter address field.
   b. Follow the prompts until “security.tls.version.min” is offered as an option.
   c. The original value for this should be “0”. Please update it to a value of “1”. This will ensure that the TLS 1.0 is the minimum required protocol version

Google Chrome/Chromium (Windows)

1. Please upgrade your Chrome browser to version 40 or above. This will disable SSL3 as a default setting.

a. On the Google Chrome shortcut, right click and then click on “Properties” followed by “Shortcut” tab

Opera

column10: Rebates are determined at the Co-operative’s Annual General Meeting and paid annually. The amounts are based on the member's purchases made during the last financial year (1 Jan to 31 Dec), up to a maximum purchase of $6,000 per annum.
